intro: Oenothera engelmannii, commonly known as Engelmann's evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that open in the evening and close by dawn. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are usually branching and upright. Oenothera engelmannii is a member of the Onagraceae family and is known for its ecological importance as a nectar source for nocturnal pollinators.
